attributes.action: stop deducting employees National Insurance contributions after you have reached 30 qualifying years.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the Pensions Act 2007, the number of qualifying years in order to obtain a full State Pension has been reduced from 44 to 30 years, from 6 April 2010.  Therefore, why is it necessary to still pay NI contributions after the 30 qualifying years have been met, unless you require bereavement benefit?  The additional money saved by the employee in not paying NI could be used, for example, to buy an additional pension or private health insurance.
